fields.description:
I've been experimenting with user profile languages and noticed that JIRA seems to use sometimes use my old profile language. See the attached image of the "Create" screen. The profile is in Spanish and most of the screen is in Spanish but the results from user picker is in German!  The server is in English (see other attachment).

I noticed the same behavior in my plugin (Tempo) but this is hardly plugin specific since the same is happening in both JIRA and GreenHopper. It looks like strings from REST services are not properly internationalized.

Best regards,

-Bjarni
fields.summary: JIRA mixes profile locales

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26984].
  {panel}

Hi there!

A client reported an issue with the UPM Plugin in JIRA 2.7.10 and I was able to reproduce it.

This is the issue: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-7881

{noformat}
com.atlassian.extras.decoder.api.LicenseDecoderNotFoundException: Could not find any valid decoders in [com.atlassian.extras.decoder.v2.Version2LicenseDecoder@f3dcf0, com.atlassian.extras.decoder.v1.Version1LicenseDecoder@2e2dc6] for license string
{noformat}

Steps to reproduce:
1. Enter in Fisheye's Administration page.
2. Click on Plugins.
3. Click on Upload Plugin.
4. Choose the file (atlassian-universal-plugin-manager-plugin-2.0.jar).
5. Click on Upload.
6. Restart Fisheye.

The error start to be showed in the Plugins Page.

I attached a screenshot of it.

Thank you in advance.

Douglas Fabretti
Atlassian Support.
fields.summary: Exception when upgrading to UPM 2.0 in Fisheye

fields.description:
When trying to search for a group which display name begins with the last letters on the alphabet and is present in another, as prefix, sulfix or in the middle of, user will not be able to select that group. That occurs because the default auto complete setting for JQL (Lucene) is to display only 20 records.
A workaround is set manually the configuration in the JPM.xml to a higher number, which will let user to find the group in a big list. However, that could reflect negatively in another JIRA behavior (performance, JQL default behavior and etc).

To reproduce that error, using an instance from the box:

-	Create a new project
-	Using a fake group called *zzz*, create at less 21 groups using that name in the middle, prefix and sulfix.

Ex:
{code}
8 group zzz - 8
9 group zzz - 9
Access 1 group zzz
access 11 group zzz -11
Access 2 group zzz - 2
Access 3 group zzz - 3
Access 4 group zzz - 4
Access 5 group zzz -5
Access 6 group zzz - 6
Access 7 group zzz - 7
Bet 19 zzz badges
Can 10 zzz group - 10
DB 16 group zzz
Fifteen zzz group
For sure zzz - 21
Force 13 group zzz - 13
Fourteen  group zzz - 14
Last 20 of zzz group
Next 12 group zzz - 12
Next zzz group 13
Under eighteen zzz group
XXX 18 zzz
zzz
{code}

-	Edit the project roles
-	Try to find and set the group *zzz* in any role

Only after change the *auto complete* default value, will be possible to find and select the group zzz.

Cheers,

Paulo Renato
fields.summary: Using group picker, alphabetic search order can create an inconsistent auto complete or don't find a group

fields.description:
Hello team,
We discovered a bug in JIRA, which the user can create an issue, via SOAP API, including new-line characters ("\n", "\r\n") on the issue summary. It causes e-mail notifications sent to users to be shown as HTML source-code, instead of the proper HTML formatted notification.
Thanks for your attention.
fields.summary: Issue summary allows new-line characters when creating issue via SOAP API

fields.description:
We've seen a spike in [issues reported by "Anonymous"|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=reporter+is+EMPTY+ORDER+BY+created+DESC%2C+updated+DESC%2C+key+DESC] in the past two weeks on JAC. This seemed to coincide with the new Quick Create dialog being used to create issues.

The issue is that if the reporter isn't visible in the dialog, it is left empty when the issue is created. This is the wrong behaviour -- the default reporter should be current user, and only empty if the user is actually not logged in.

Steps to reproduce:

# Log in as a user on JAC
# Click the 'Create Issue' link on the toolbar
# Ensure the dialog doesn't have the Reporter field visible (true by default)
# Change the project on the issue
# Create an issue

Expected behaviour:

* The Reporter of the new issue is the user who created the issue

Actual behaviour:

* The Reporter is "Anonymous".

_Update_: this only happens when I change the project in the Create Issue dialog while creating the issue, which also clears out other fields: summary, etc. [~delkan] thinks this could be related that that issue.
fields.summary: Issues created via Quick Create dialog have Anonymous reporter

fields.description:
POST on /api/2/issue with request body

{
"fields":{
  "project": { "key":"DB" },
  "summary" : "test setting default Security Level with REST",
  "issuetype": {"id":"100017"}
}
}

generates response with HTTP status 500 and body

{"errorMessages":["Internal server error"],"errors":{}}

JIRA logs say:

{code}
2012-01-30 15:28:54,492 http-10500-23 ERROR admin 988x39522x1 6rzffc 192.168.11.105 /rest/api/2/issue [jira.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor] Returning internal server error in respon
se
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
<...>
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.issuetype.DefaultIssueTypeScreenSchemeManager.getFieldScreenScheme(DefaultIssueTypeScreenSchemeManager.java:161)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.StandardFieldScreenRendererFactory.createFieldScreenRenderer(StandardFieldScreenRendererFactory.java:49)

<...>
{code}

Full stack trace: see attachment.

In the project with key "DB" there are no required fields other than "Summary".

Note that no NPE occurs when issue type ID is provided correctly (i.e., "7" instead of "100017".)
fields.summary: NPE when creating new issue using REST and an incorrect Project/Issuetype combination.

fields.description:
Using the standard renderer for the Components picker in JIRA 4.2+, if you have a project with a very large amount of components, it can take an excruciatingly long time to load. This can be long enough for IE8 can time out whilst waiting for the component list to load.

Currently we can work around these issues by either pruning the number of components available, or by starting to type the component name in the box right away, before the down arrow is clicked, as this will only load a subset of those components.

However we should look at a way to make this field scale better when used with large instances, or instances with a large number of components, if possible.
fields.summary: Components Field Does Not Scale
Built-in filters should be editable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26963].
  {panel}

We are using com.atlassian.jira.service.services.imap.ImapService to create issues/comments from emails.

We are always using Outlook 2010 and each of our users has an image in the signature which includes the company logo. 

When our end users send us a issue via email this image is always uploaded into JIRA as attachment. 

My request for a new feature would be to filter images based upon naming,size,type (or any other pattern you can find) out of the emails. Otherwise each new comment/issue will have plenty of signature images attached.
fields.summary: Filter image when creating issue/comment from email

fields.description:
Time entries are displayed -1 hour in JIRA issues compared to the real time, when having JIRA configured to use the Russia timezone as the system default time (tested specifically on the Asia/Novosibirsk tz). Steps to reproduce are:
- Append -Duser.timezone=Asia/Novosibirsk in the {{setenv.bat}} (Windows) or {{setenv.sh}} (UNIX)
- Start JIRA application
- Check the System time displayed in the System Information ({{Administration > System Information}}), and the time displayed is correct
!scshot1.png!
- Create a JIRA issue, and the timestamp in the date created/updated will be incorrect. Same goes to the comments timestamp and also user timezone info:
!scshot2.png!
fields.summary: Incorrect Time Displayed for JIRA Issues when having Russia Timezone Configured
If a plugin causes an active objects exception that plugin should be automatically disabled.

fields.description:
Ever since we set up a bunch of systems with OAuth links (JAC, EAC, CAC, etc.), I seem to be continually clicking through to re-authenticate with the JIRA systems.

Is the timeout on OAuth tokens set too low, or are they expiring incorrectly due to restarts or some config change? I think these tokens should probably last indefinitely (like 5-10 years), since the user has the ability to delete them if the authenticated access is no longer desirable.
fields.summary: OAuth tokens provided to Confluence (e.g. JIRA issue links) seem to expire too quickly

fields.description:
When attempting to attach files from the create issue page, attachments do not appear when the issue is created.

To reproduce the bug:
1. Create an issue.
2. Upload an attachment.
3. Press create.

Note that the file is no where to be found in the issue page.
fields.summary: Attaching files on Create Issue Page does not work.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26942].
  {panel}

I just wanted to checkup on our database documentation for JIRA.  As you know, JIRA 4.4+ has the database setup within the Setup Wizard.  This is already noted here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+a+Database
bq. If you are setting up a completely new JIRA installation, the JIRA Setup Wizard will configure a database connection for you to either JIRA's internal HSQL database or an external database.

The problem is if a customer only checks their specific database sections:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+MySQL
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2005
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+SQL+Server+2008
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+HSQLDB
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Connecting+JIRA+to+PostgreSQL

The titles are called 'Connecting JIRA to ____', but in none of these documentations tell a reader that the connection can be setup via JIRA's initial Setup Wizard.

How does a customer get directly to the 'Connecting to ____' pages?
Google is one example.  If you simply type in "jira mysql" into Google, the first few results go directly to 'Connecting JIRA to MySQL'.

I just wanted to bring this to your attention and see if this is something that we should change.
fields.summary: Database documentation does not indicate connections can be setup via the Setup Wizard

When updating an issue, JIRA does not validate the version/s and component/s are valid for the selected project. Normally this is not a problem, but it can lead to invalid components being assigned to an issue.

Steps to reproduce:

# Open an issue for editing in one browser window 
# In another browser window, move the issue to a new project
# In the first browser window hit the update button

Result - the Version/s and component/s will be saved with values from the old project

Expected Result - A validation error saying the issue had been moved whilst editing

fields.description:
If a new context is created for a custom field and if the applicable context is selected as a given project, the search screen still shows it for all projects (even after clicking refresh search).  If at the root level of custom field if the applicable context is selected as a project, the search screen filters it well.

To Reproduce:
1) Create a Custom Field Test Ajay Goel
2) Choose applicable issue types as All Issue Types
3) Choose applicable context as Global Context (will talk about it later)
4) In Associate field Test Ajay Goel to screens, select any screen
5) In View Custom Fields Screen, click configure next to "Test Ajay Goel"
6) Click "Add new Context"
7) In Configuration scheme label give name "Test Ajay Goel for Project A"
8) In Choose applicable context, select project A
9) Add another new context and repeat 6-8 for Project B
10) Go to Issue navigator, select project C, click Refresh Search and expand Custom Fields 

Expected behavior:
Test Ajay Goel should not be visible

Actual behavior:
Test Ajay Goel is visible.

Please note that after having created two contexts for this custom fields for project A and B, at the root Custom Field level, I cannot set the applicable context to project A and B (they are not there in the list).  The same this is true the other way round as well.  If I create a custom field and set at the root level the applicable context, I can not add a new context for those two projects.

Basically, I need to create a custom field that is only visible to two projects but they look differently (say have different title or options) between those two projects.
fields.summary: Custom field with multiple contexts not filtered on search screen

fields.description:
The following documentation specifies that the {{jira.search.views.max.limit}} setting is disabled by default:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Limiting+the+number+of+issues+returned+from+a+search+view+such+as+an+RSS+feed

However, the setting is specified in the {{WEB-INF/classes/jpm.xml}} file that ships with JIRA 4.4.3 and 4.4.4 (and possibly other 4.4.x releases).

{code:xml}
<property>
    <!--
        Whether search results are capped to a hard limit, otherwise return a 403 (Forbidden) to the client.
        Set this to negative (-1) or empty for unlimited results.
        NOTE: this must be EQUAL TO OR GREATER THAN jira.search.views.default.max above, otherwise all Issue Navigator links will fail with a 403
    -->
    <key>jira.search.views.max.limit</key>
    <default-value>1000</default-value>
    <type>uint</type>
    <user-editable>false</user-editable>
</property>
{code}

This is particularly troublesome when upgrading from pre-4.4 releases, since this represents a change in behaviour for users that is difficult to notice during the upgrade.

----

The documentation has since been corrected but [~kavian] is now suggesting that we should consider changing the default value in this to be greater than what it currently is or reduce the default value of {{jira.search.views.default.max}}
fields.summary: Consider changing the default value for jira.search.views.max.limit property in the jpm.xml file.

fields.description:
1) Send a share or mention email.
2) Log out of JIRA.
3) Check your email and click the "Add Comment" link (or the "Watch Issue" link once it's reimplemented in 5.1 as planned).
4) You get a login screen. Log in.

You are redirected to the correct issue screen but the anchor (e.g. #add-comment) is long gone.

Notes:
* Looking at the HTTP traffic, browsers never send the anchor to the server, so it's unsurprising that it gets lost in the redirect. I don't think we should be using an anchor at all for this purpose. Is there are reason we didn't use a standard query arg? (e.g. ?action=add-comment)
* Affects both OnDemand and BTF.
* It works if you have "Remember my Login" checked, unless you're in GApps mode, which doesn't support it.
fields.summary: Share/Mention actions from email are lost across the login process

fields.description:
1) Start from an empty project
2) Create one issue
3) Set FixVersion for this issue to one unreleased version available in your project, say, version V1
4) Clone your issue, creating a snd one.
At this stage, you have two issues, with fixes due for version V1 in your project. Both have been created today.
5) Launch a request on history of your project, asking the issues whose fixVersion have been set to V1 today. You will get only the first issue, the clone, snd, issue, will not be listed in the result. This is wrong.

I see that as an inconsistent behavior as, as a user, if I know there was no issue associated to a version yesterday, and I'm seeing two issues currently associated to this very version now, I'm expecting to retrieve these two issues when asking which issues had their fixversion set to V1 today. And issues created by cloning are breaking this assumption (probably because they are created without history information, whatever the history information found in original issue), leading to results of query on history that will be seen as incoherent when compared with queries on current state of issue database.
fields.summary: Issues created by cloning are invisible to history searches

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26898].
  {panel}

When assigning an issue the notification is sent, however when bulk assigning issues the notifications are not.

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Set your Notification Scheme to send an email to the current assignee when an issue is assigned. (_as shown in the screenshot "NotificationScheme"_)
# Assign an issue to the user e.g. *User1*.
#* The user will receive a notification. (_See attached screenshot "SingleAssignment"_)
# Bulk assign several issues to e.g. *User2* (_I tested assigning 3 at once_)
#* The user will not receive any notifications.

(The names was just for example, you can assign all to the same users and he will only receive notifications when an issue is assigned without using bulk edit)
fields.summary: The notifications are not sent when bulk assigning issues

BUSHIDO-567
{noformat}

Expected result:

{noformat}
ADJ-80
ADJ-76
ADS-2984
ALC-1686
BUSHIDO-567
{noformat}

It appears that project sort is neither alphabetical nor chronological (by project creation time) as of JIRA 4.2.4.

fields.description:
When I have to switch between projects inside the popup creatin screen, in order to display a contextualized customfield (mine or JIRA native), the default value isn't selected.

If I close the popup screen while having the good project selected, and reopen the creation popup, then the default value is selected as expected.

I took a look at JIRA source code with Eclipse debugging, and it seems that the method "*void populateDefaults(Map fieldValuesHolder, Issue issue);*" from the [OrderableField|http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/5.0-rc3/com/atlassian/jira/issue/fields/OrderableField.html#populateDefaults(java.util.Map, com.atlassian.jira.issue.Issue)] class isn't called inside the popup when switching between projects.
It could help :-)

Good cheer !
Clément Capiaux
Valiantys developer

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Log out of JAC
# Go to [Configure Pie Chart|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ConfigureReport!default.jspa?selectedProjectId=10240&reportKey=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.reports:pie-report]
# Click "Select Filter or Project". The filter/project picker asks you to log in (!).

There are filters and projects that are viewable by anonymous users, so we shouldn't *require* people to log in at this stage. If the chart is not viewable by anonymous users at all then perhaps the link shouldn't be shown?
fields.summary: Pie chart report asks me to log in unnecessarily

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26888].
  {panel}

In regards to [GHS-3904] and [GHS-3904|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-3904] it has been discovered that up until recently customers have been asked to set up their Oracle databases with missing privelages to create sequences and and triggers. 

The documentation has since taken amendments [JRA-26840],[JRA-26879].

As an improvement/bug can it be made that upon install/upgrade of JIRA 5.0 onwards that JIRA can check the oracle database to see that it has the correct privelages? This should catch the bad configurations where they start. 

AO requires these privelages when creating tables etc... in the database and will fail if these are set otherwise.
fields.summary: Jira 5 to stop upgrade/install if Oracle database permissions are incorrect.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26884].
  {panel}

It's a common issue in support: 
Customers will create Custom Field, associate it to the right schemes but complain they can't add the Custom Field to a screen.

It's always due to the Context.

Maybe, we should put a reminder so customers could check it.
fields.summary: Configuring a Screen could suggest users to review Custom Field context

fields.description:
We are currently using JIRA to track and manage defects raised by multiple teams. Each team has a JIRA project - and users are generally permitted to raise issues within their own projects. Issues can be moved between projects to reflect whoever currently has responsibility for each particular issue.

When an issue is moved between projects the reporter changes (for some reason). It is important for us that the reporter remains the same irrespective of which project the issue resides within.

I would appreciate any help or explanation that anyone can provide of why this is happening - and how to stop it happening. As I cannot seem to determine the problem / solution by myself.
fields.summary: The reporter keeps changing when I move issues between projects

fields.description: At the moment with the following configuration JIRA -> CROWD -> Delegated directory, users authentication in JIRA will fail untill the directory has been synchronized. Though this is expected since authentication is via the crowd server, It will be nice if we can have something similar to *Copy User on Login* feature where by users can be associated to a default group and have their group membership synchronized on first attempt to login. This is something achievable with JIRA -> LDAP configuration.
fields.summary: JIRA with delegated LDAP directory connected through crowd should auto synchronize user details and groups on first login

fields.description:
If a username contains space(s) (Ie. JIRA Admin), then the activity stream on the User's Profile will not work properly

Steps to replicate:
# Create a user with spaces (Ie. *JIRA Admin*)
# Perform any actions on any issue (Ie. Start Progress, Resolved, and etc)
# The above action should be displayed on the Profile's Activitiy Stream, but it does not   
** Either the Profile's Activity Stream shows no activity or 
** Show another user activity with the same username's prefix (In this case, *JIRA*)

Note: The activity will show as normal on the activity stream's gadget.
fields.summary: A username with space(s) cannot view his/her activity on the User's profile
Allow runtime configuration of new loggers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26879].
  {panel}

Could the following pages include some warning about the Oracle permission fix on upgrade as documented [here|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+5.0+Upgrade+Notes#JIRA50UpgradeNotes-JIRAserversusingOracledatabases] to include the create triggers and create sequences permission.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+Installation+and+Upgrade+Guide#GreenHopperInstallationandUpgradeGuide-UpgradingGreenHopper
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+5.8.4+Upgrade+Notes#GreenHopper584UpgradeNotes-UpgradingfromGreenHopper57xorearlier
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/GreenHopper+5.8+Upgrade+Notes#GreenHopper58UpgradeNotes-UpgradingfromGreenHopper57xto58
fields.summary: GreenHopper upgrade to 5.8.x documentation to include warnings of Oracle DB permissions
Automatically assign new items to a release
Add new permission level 'Edit Closed Issue'

fields.description:
Open multiple issues in multiple tabs.
Start the process on moving one issue to a different project.
Before you click submit go to the second issue and start the move process.
Go back to the first tab and click the submit button to continue.
You will receive an error.

This is probably a fringe error, I don't see this being a large issue for most people. However, sometimes our servers are slow and I move between tasks rather quickly, start the process on one, move to the next click to the next step and so on and so forth, so I get caught with this regularly.
fields.summary: Moving multiple issues in multiple tabs create error
Standard capability to make bulk changes to projects in Jira

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26870].
  {panel}

In Project Administration's People section, it is easy to distinguish user by referring their email address and username when they insert user's full name:

!first-user.jpg|thumbsnail!
!second-user.png|thumbsnail!

But when there are a lot of name-collisions in user directory, it is not easy for admin to check the following Full Name is belongs to whom.

!screenshot.220.jpg|thumbsnail!

*Suggestion*: It will be great if admin have the option to show extra user information or custom properties (such as department, team and etc) besides the Full Name display. 

Same goes to Issue's Person section:

!screenshot.221.jpg|thumbsnail!

The hover action on user name will display their information is good enough, somehow, we can improve this section as well as above suggestion.
fields.summary: Ability to show more user information in Project's People section display and Issue's Person section display
Dashboard for a target date in the past

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26868].
  {panel}

This exists in 4.4.4 and 5.x, so I expect it's been the case for all time.  To reproduce:
1. Create a user with a special character in both the username and the password.  "josé" is a convenient example (You can probably enter it using option-e followed by another e on a Mac or holding down Alt while typing 0233 on the numeric keypad on Windows.)
2. Verify that the new user can log in using the same browser on the same platform.
3. Attempt to log in using a different browser on a different platform.  Frequently, this does not work.

The problem seems to be that the password field's character set depends on the platform and browser settings.  On my Mac, I found that Chrome and Safari on the Mac were generally compatible with one another, but neither would interoperate with Firefox on the Mac or with IE8/9 running on a Windows system.

I think what's happening here is that (at least as far as I can see) the input form does not specify the accept-charset HTML attribute, leaving the choice up to the browser.  Form submission is not necessarily constrained to use the same charset as the HTML that created the form.

My understanding is that you can use accept-charset="UTF-8" in the form element to force most browsers to use that encoding for their data.  IE apparently ignores this but can be convinced to behave itself by including a (hidden) input with a value like U+2620 (SKULL AND CROSSBONES), to force it to use UTF-8 form the whole form.

Note that usernames are not affected; this only seems to impact the password.  Naturally, none of this matters if you can convince users that they should stick with ASCII-only passwords.
fields.summary: I18N encoding of user passwords is not consistent across browsers/platforms

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26867].
  {panel}

1) Configure a connection to Zendesk. 
2) From the View Issue page, attempt to create a link to a ZenDesk ticket.

The dialog shows no errors, and when you click "Link" it closes but doesn't create the link. There is no indication in the UI about what has gone wrong.

http://screencast.com/t/ZWFPCV3BEUf

* A connection test completes successfully.
* There are no records of anything in the diagnostics except the successful connection tests.
* I've set up authentication to the jira-agent@customware.net user using the API token shown on the Zendesk pages.
* The only possibly relevant info in the JIRA logs is this:
{noformat}
@400000004f18b8ca02d5076c 2012-01-20 11:43:44,047 TP-Processor2 WARN admin 703x3019x1 sgozdw 59.167.133.3,59.167.133.69 
/plugins/servlet/customware/connector/config.action [apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector] 
Required proxy credentials not available for BASIC <any realm>@squid:3128
@400000004f18b8ca0330660c 2012-01-20 11:43:44,053 TP-Processor2 WARN admin 703x3019x1 sgozdw 59.167.133.3,59.167.133.69 
/plugins/servlet/customware/connector/config.action [apache.commons.httpclient.HttpMethodDirector] 
Preemptive authentication requested but no default proxy credentials available
{noformat}
I remember we've encountered that message before with the Connectors but I think it was a false alarm.

To be clear, there are three issues here:
1) (As a tester) I can't get it working and I don't know why, so I can't complete the testing.
2) (As an end-user) I have no error feedback to let me know I need to get an admin to look at it.
3) (As an admin) I have no information to help me identify and fix the issue.

Please feel free to log in to https://jirra.jira-dev.com (Log in as a Studio user, admin/admin ) to investigate.
fields.summary: Customware Connectors - cannot create a Zendesk link and no error feedback is provided
